node.title: Blind drag racer has a lesson about following your dreams
node.description: I chose this week's story mainly for an audience of one — Ted, my nephew who says his blindness sometimes feels insurmountable.

node.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy tells 60 Minutes what he saw in Bucha: "Death. Just death."
node.description: Scott Pelley interviewed Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Kyiv for a two-part report that airs Sunday on 60 Minutes.

node.title: Book excerpt: "Freezing Order" by Bill Browder
node.description: The financier and bestselling author of "Red Notice" helped create the Magnitsky Act, aimed at freezing the assets of those involved in human rights violations, thereby making himself a target of Vladimir Putin.

node.title: Waitematā Harbour training exercise keeps rescue chopper busy
node.description: A seemingly dramatic rescue is under way on Auckland's Waitematā Harbour, but it's not what it seems.

node.title: Idaho Supreme Court temporarily blocks new abortion law
node.description: The ruling from Idaho's high court in a lawsuit brought by Planned Parenthood means the new law won't go into effect as planned on April 22.

node.title: Flypast to mark 85 years of Royal New Zealand Airforce
node.description: The 85th anniversary of the Royal New Zealand Airforce, Te Tauaarangi o Aotearoa will be marked on Saturday with a flypast over most of the North Island.

node.title: Highlanders get first Super Rugby Pacific win
node.description: Highlanders finally on the board in Super Rugby Pacific.

node.title: Duck hunters warned to be vigilant in Southland
node.description: Southland duck hunters urged to take care this weekend in view of the wetlands fire south of Invercargill

node.title: Person critically injured in shooting in Auckland CBD
node.description: Police say someone was shot and critically injured in central Auckland last night.

node.title: Coroner recommends helmets worn when breaking in horses
node.description: A coroner is recommending anyone breaking in a horse - whether mounted or unmounted - wear a helmet when handling them.

node.title: 150 shelter dogs that survived starvation in Ukraine denied entry to Poland
node.description: After being trapped for weeks in a shelter near Borodyanka without food or water, 150 dogs were rescued by volunteers and driven to the Poland border – only to be turned away.

node.title: Four suspended Secret Service employees probed in case involving federal agent impostors
node.description: The Secret Service investigation will also determine whether the USSS employees will be able to keep their security clearances.

node.title: College admissions scam: Test taker gets prison time, ex-USC coach found guilty
node.description: Riddell made more than $200,000 by cheating on over 25 exams, prosecutors said.

node.title: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," April 10, 2022
node.description: White House National National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan, Ukrainian Ambassador to the United States Oksana Markarova and more appear on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" this Sunday.

node.title: Read the letter Harris wrote to her goddaughter about Jackson's confirmation
node.description: "I told her that I felt such a deep sense of pride and joy and about what this moment means for our nation and for her future," Harris said.

node.title: Judge declines to slow N.Y. primary elections despite ongoing redistricting battle
node.description: The appeals judge said he would allow a lower court judge to hire an expert to draw up alternative congressional district maps in case the disputed ones ultimately get tossed.

node.title: Reduced audiences covered under government's expanded events insurance
node.description: More events through to next February - including those affected by smaller crowds - will now be eligible for cover under the expanded scheme.

node.title: Long Covid: Sufferers warn of virus' long-term impacts
node.description: Long Covid sufferers and researchers are calling for urgent support and warning employers to start planning for the possibility that the virus could impact on their workforce in ways they have not… Audio

node.title: Warriors extend winning streak in nail-biter
node.description: Warriors come from behind to secure a golden point win against the North Queensland Cowboys.

node.title: Amazon plans to file objections to Staten Island union election
node.description: Ecommerce giant claims members of Amazon Labor Union threatened warehouse workers to vote in favor of organizing effort.

node.title: Man who took exams as part of college admissions scam sentenced to prison
node.description: Riddell made more than $200,000 by cheating on over 25 exams, prosecutors said.

node.title: Two in hospital, one arrested after stabbing at Hamilton school
node.description: Two people have been seriously injured in a stabbing at a Hamilton secondary school, police have told Checkpoint.

node.title: Alabama governor signs sweeping law banning trans youth healthcare
node.description: Under the new law, doctors face criminal penalties for providing puberty blockers or hormones for those under 19.

node.title: Dunedin mayor hopeful Octagon protesters will avoid 'confrontation'
node.description: A group of antivax and anti-mandate protesters have been given an ultimatum by the Dunedin City Council - pack up and leave, or be moved on.

node.title: 'A paradigm shift?': Shock result could spark physics revolution
node.description: Scientists find a sub-atomic particle's mass is at odds with a theory underpinning modern physics.

node.title: Tesla throws massive grand opening for "Gigafactory" in Texas
node.description: Electric car maker's new factory will employ up to 10,000 workers and build its Model 3, Model Y and Cybertruck.

node.title: People of color face higher rental costs than Whites: Zillow
node.description: Black and Hispanic Americans pay higher security deposits and application fees than Whites, analysis shows.

node.title: Two unruly flight passengers could face largest-ever fines
node.description: The Federal Aviation Administration wants sock the disruptive passengers with fines of about $80,000 each.

node.title: Police praise farmer for quick action after deer shot on nearby property
node.description: A farmer is being praised for his quick response to seeing poachers on a neighbouring property.

node.title: Far-right's Le Pen closes in on Macron in French presidential race
node.description: The least a president might expect, when juggling a war in Europe with an election at home, is a bounce in the polls.
